de.iabg.mesh
Class DefaultMeshModel

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.mesh.DefaultMeshModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, MeshModel, Loggable
public class DefaultMeshModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements MeshModel

This implementation of MeshModel attempts to create all the functionality described in the MeshModel class description. Refer to the class API for more details. Much of the implementation of this class should be straight-forward, however, a more in-depth summary of the data structure may clarify some conceptual issues. A NodeConnectionMatrix is a DiagonalMatrix which stores the identifiers of the First Nodes as the rows and the identifiers of the Last Nodes as the columns. It can also store a correlation value along the diagonal, but for the purposes of this class, it is enough to consider that there is essentially a mapping between the First Nodes and Last Nodes. Node connection data, such as an edge, has a First Node and a Last Node, which can be added to such NodeConnectionMatrix for as many edges as required. A triangle has three nodes and three edges, and these three edges can be added in exactly the same way. Similarly, the four edges of a quadrilateral can be added. Java3D can read in geometry as arrays of coordinates as can be read in its API and documentation. To render a NodeConnectionMatrix, we can copy the NodeMatrix and sort its nodes using the ordering of the First Nodes of the NodeConnectionMatrix. The values of the NodeMatrix can then assigned in Java3D. This works well for nodes, triangles, and quadrilaterals. For edges, the ordering of the Last Nodes is also required, so another copy of the NodeMatrix using this ordering must be merged into that of the First Nodes. Triangles and quadrilaterals can then be visualized as wire frame lines or filled solids by changing the appropriate polygon attributes.

Version:
November 1, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Constructor Detail

DefaultMeshModel

public DefaultMeshModel(JMeshPanel meshPanel)
Constructs a default DefaultMeshModel with no stored data. This constructor also initializes all the storage objects, which should not be destroyed during the life of this object. This is because listeners may register themselves to these objects, and will not receive notifications if the references to these objects are changed. This constructor also stores a reference to the JMeshPanel, so that this model has access to all the methods of that component.

Parameters:
meshPanel - the JMeshPanel that this model is designed for

isConsistent

public boolean isConsistent()
Description copied from interface: MeshModel
Tests if all the node keys of this MeshModel are contained in the stored nodes. If there are no stored nodes or no stored node keys, this method should return true.

Specified by:
isConsistent in interface MeshModel
Returns:
true if all node keys are contains in the nodes, if there are no stored nodes, or if there are no stored node key; false otherwise
